results.title: Down on the Factory Farm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
An examination of intensive farming methods used in Great Britain today for raising chicken, pigs and vealers. Investigates the question of increased productivity and cheaper food versus animal welfare. There is some evidence that more natural alternatives to factory farming can have much the same production levels for marginally extra cost

results.title: The Desert dreamers
results.creator_credit: Geoff Dunlop and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A video about the paintings produced by the Papunya Aboriginal people, some 200 miles from Alice Springs. Looking like twentieth century abstracts, the paintings use an extremely complex symbolic language that relates to religious ceremonies. Some of them are outstandingly beautiful. All reveal the richness of desert Aboriginal life and culture. Shows the lives of the painters and their families, desert nomads who are being forced to come to terms with the realities of white technology, economics and values.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee II. (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Cornell, Jane Scott and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Begins in New York where Dundee now lives with his journalist girlfriend. In order to escape the pursuit of an international drug ring who have murdered her former husband, Dundee and his girlfriend return to the Australian outback where Dundee is well prepared to confront them.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Fairman, John Cornell, Hoyts, Paramount Pictures and Rimfire Films
results.brief_description: A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter (Paul Hogan) and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan, where his very outback Australian approach to the dangers of a big city, make him a success in New York society.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee
results.creator_credit: Peter Faiman, John Cornell, Hoyts, Paramount Pictures and Rimfire Films
results.brief_description: A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter, Mick ‘Crocodile’ Dundee, and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan where his easy-going approach to the dangers of life in a big city make him a success in New York society. Stars Paul Hogan and Linda Kozlowski.

results.title: Crime and punishment
results.brief_description: Directed by Josef Von Sternberg this is the first English language version of Dostoyevsky’s novel of obsession, murder and guilt. Peter Lorre stars as the criminology student turned murderer and Edward Arnold as the detective who breaks him. This is an example of Hollywood tackling the great Russian epic and achieving it with style.

results.title: Creating with ceramics
results.creator_credit: David Hubbard, Dick Hoffman, Tom Hubbard and Crystal
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to the techniques of clay gathering, mixing, wedging, throwing, glazing and firing by showing three potters creating three pieces, each of a different style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Hubbard, Dick Hoffman, Tom Hubbard and Crystal

results.title: Crane
results.creator_credit: Margaret Anne Smith, Australian Film Commission and Smith Street Films
results.brief_description: Set in the shipping terminal at Glebe Island, Sydney this short film explores the life and emotions of crane-operator Ron Watson (Robert Noble) who is facing a crisis situation both at home and at work. His job is demanding, often requiring shift-work and long hours. His marriage is falling apart because of his obsession with work and yet Ron seems unable to prevent the inevitable. And the job itself is a dangerous one requiring total focus and agility. Ron, like many of his co-workers on the water front, finally is confronted with the stresses around him and is forced to face the grim reality of his situation. Cast also includes Maya Potter, Joseph Petruzzi, Bob Hornery, Nicholas Flanagan. Original music by Colin Watson, Jim Conway with drums by Hanumandas and cinematography by Brendon Young.

results.title: Crafts of my province = Artisans de nouveau Brunswick [French language]
results.creator_credit: Marcel Martin, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A documentary on Canadian artisans from New Brunswick revolving around a sculptress and her husband who is a potter. Shows how they decorate, glaze and fire the pottery and each year open their house as a showroom to lovers of art. We meet their friends who are silversmiths and get inspiration from the sea and rocks and use stones to make jewellery. Also shows wool being dyed and woven into cloth for sale to the USA and overseas.

results.title: Crafts of My Province
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson, Kirk Jones, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film visit to New Brunswick craftsmen, such as the potters Kjeld and Erica Deichmann of Sussex, N.B., who demonstrate all stages, from potter’s wheel to kiln. Shown also are the hand-looming of woolens and the designing of jewelry from local stones and silver.
